actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 13 October. Youth at a rlly called the Platform for Change burned tires in the streets of Lubumbashi. Police dispersed them.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change
notes: 12 October. Activists for the fight for change, Lucha, were dispersed by the police with tear gas as they protested in Beni.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 12 October. Rioters calling for peace in Beni clashed with police in Butembo town, leaving several injured.

actor1: Government of Angola (1975-)
notes: Displacement: October 1-11: A total of 188,720 suspected illegal Congolese migrants in Angola were forcibly returned to Kasai.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Agreement: 12 October. Militiamen of the Nduma defense of Congo (NDC / Renovee) and Mai-Mai Mazembe surrendered to the security services in Lubero.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10-11 October. The people of Tshonka in Shabunda territory (South Kivu) organized protests over two days to demand the departure of a mining operator.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 October. Hundreds of teachers from all the unions of the schools of the city of Bukavu (South Kivu) protested in front of the cabinet of the governor of province, to denounce the insecurity in the schools of the city.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10-11 October. The people of Tshonka in Shabunda territory (South Kivu) organized protests over two days to demand the departure of a mining operator.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 October. During the trial of Moise Katumbi Chapwe, activists of "Together for Change" stormed the Court, to show their support for their leader.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 09 October. A crowd of students was dispersed with tear gas by police as they marched to denounce the insecurity that prevails in Beni in North Kivu. Police fired tear gas and live bullets at a crowd of protesters that tried to enter the residence of a high-ranking military cadre in an area of Beni, leaving four injured.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 09 October. Suspected ADF ambushed and killed two civilians in Kisiki-Maimoya on the Oisha-Eringeti National Highway No. 4 in Beni. FARDC intervened soon after, exchanging fire with the attackers (coded in a separate event).

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 09 October. Suspected ADF ambushed and killed two civilians in Kisiki-Maimoya on the Oisha-Eringeti National Highway No. 4 in Beni. FARDC intervened soon after, exchanging fire with the attackers (coded in a separate event).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 October. Detonations of heavy and light weapons were heard in the commune of Ruwenzori around Kasinga city of Beni. Residents also left the place and moved to the city.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 October. Women gathered in the street of Beni to demand the return of peace in the municipality of Ruwenzori.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 08 October. MONUSCO reinforcements repelled an attack on Congolese military by suspected ADF fighters in Kasinga.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 07 October. Demonstrators vandalized the office of the central police station of the PNC and released all the detainees Kolwezi. Six wounded policemen and several rioters arrested.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 06 October. Fourteen people were killed in an incursion by an armed group in the Rubaya mining trading center in Masisi territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 04 October. ADF rebels attacked an army position in Paida, on the outskirts of the city of Beni (North Kivu) and four soldiers were killed.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03 October. Protesters in Oicha took to the streets to demand the release of 17 abductees including children in majority by ADF rebels on September 22 in Mabapula.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 02 October. A group of armed men attacked a FARDC position in Karuruma, four attackers were killed in the army's response.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: IDPs/Refugees (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Looting: 02 October. Report that Congolege forces were extorting money from DRC returneees at the border post of Kamako, 150 km south of Tshikapa, in the province of Kasai (approx. Coordinates used based on a humanitarian map). They were being forcibly returned from Angola.

actor1: Butembo Community Militia
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (International)
notes: 02 October. Two Red Cross workers were seriously wounded when community members attacked them while they were carrying out safe Ebola burials in the north-eastern city of Butembo.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Germany)
notes: 01 October. A German tourist was killed by a man belonging to a gang of four assailants in the city of Boma. His wife survived.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 October. Activists of the Fight for Change movement (LUCHA) marched in Kananga to condemn the continuing violence in Beni and to call on the authorities to secure people and their property.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 01 October. A soldier and a civilian were wounded in an attack by armed men against a FARDC position in Tshiawu on the outskirts of Kananga town on the Mbuji-Mayi road.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 30 September. Two soldiers were wounded in Tshiawu in Nganza commune during clashes between security forces and an unidentified militia.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 September. Opposition political party activists marched to Triomphal Boulevard in Kinshasa to demand the release of political prisoners and the return of the people in exile.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 29 September. Oicha - Police disperse protest held against the death of two civilians after an attack by ADF at Mukoko the day before.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 29 September. Police beat seven activists (including Rebecca Kavugho and Queen Mwanzi) in Goma as they peacefully protested the continued violence in Beni.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 September. Protest against the insecurity in the city of Bukavu. Police beat and abused a journalist on the margins of the protest who was covering the event.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 September. Police beat and abused a journalist on the margins of a protest against insecurity in Bukavu. The journalist was covering the event.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 29 September. FDLR attacked FRDC positions in Mutao village in Nyiragongo territory and in nearby Kanyatsi village in Masisi territroy, forcing the inhabitants to flee. The FDLR came from the Virunga National Park. Coded as two separate events.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 29 September. FDLR attacked FRDC positions in Mutao village in Nyiragongo territory and in nearby Kanyatsi village in Masisi territroy, forcing the inhabitants to flee. The FDLR came from the Virunga National Park. Coded as two separate events.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 28 September. Two civilians were killed and eight others disappeared in an attack by the alleged ADF in Mukoko village, 6km north of Oicha city (approx. Coordinates used).

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 28 September. Suspected ADF attacked an army position at Mutabo killing two soldiers. The army denounced an increase in raids by foreign groups from neighbouring countries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 28 September. Two soldiers were killed in the attack of a FARDC position by unknown gunmen in Linga locality in Djugu territory.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 28 September. In the FARDC offensive against assailants in the village of Malali in the Ladhejo groupement, three people including the head of this locality and two women were killed and others wounded .

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 28 September. FARDC launched offensive against assailants in the village of Aidha in the Dhendro group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 26 September. One person was shot dead in Kasindi, bordered with Uganda.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 24 September. The Army regained control of a number of towns in and around Kilembwe in Fizi territory occupied for more than a week by a Mai-Mai militia led by Yakutumba (a coalition of Malaika and Alleluia militias). Yakutumba withdrew  without a fight in the locality of Kilembwe. Coded as two separate events, one battle-gov regains, one non-violent transfer.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Yakutumba)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 24 September. The Army regained control of a number of towns in and around Kilembwe in Fizi territory occupied for more than a week by a Mai-Mai militia led by Yakutumba (a coalition of Malaika and Alleluia militias). Yakutumba withdrew  without a fight in the locality of Kilembwe. Coded as two separate events, one battle-gov regains, one non-violent transfer.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 24 September. A police officer shot dead a man at a bistro in Kakuku village in Mwenga territory after a discussion about the exoneration of the Mwenga territorial administrator, who had been accused of supporting local gangs.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 24 September. Police dispersed protesters at Busawa village in Mwenga territory. The population was protesting the release of the territory's administrator who had been arrested for supporting armed gangs and illegal possession of weapons.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 23-24 September. Six people, including two soldiers and four civilians, were killed in two attacks by armed men against FARDC positions in Tagba (Sept 23rd) in Irumu, Ituri , and in Bule in Djugu territory (Sept 24th). Six fatalities spread over two events.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 23-24 September. Six people, including two soldiers and four civilians, were killed in two attacks by armed men against FARDC positions in Tagba (Sept 23rd) in Irumu, Ituri , and in Bule in Djugu territory (Sept 24th). Six fatalities spread over two events.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 22 September. Suspected ADF militants stormed the eastern town of Beni, claiming at least 18 killed – 14 civilians and four soldiers.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 22 September. Deputy Interior Minister Basile Olongo's convoy was attacked by unidentified gunmen at Hianga in Sankuru province. Olongo was on his way from Lodja to Katako Kombe. The convoy was guarded by policemen. There were several injured.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 22 September. An army position in Mabapula, east of Oicha, 35 km north of the city of Beni, was burned by alleged ADF fighters, a civilian was killed and 17 went missing including children. Approx. coordinates used.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 22 September. After attacking an army position in Mabapula, east of Oicha, 35 km north of the city of Beni, ADF abducted 17 people, including children. Approx. Coordinates used.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 20-21 September. FARDC regained several territory from the Mai-Mai Yakutumba along the border between Maniema and South-Kivu over two days of fighting. On the first day, fighting in Tubangoyi (Sud-Kivu) left fatalities on both sides. The next day, clashes were reported in Kabeya (Maniema), Mai Ndombe (Sud-Kivu) and Kilembwe (Sud-Kivu). Coordinates of Tubangoyi and Mai Ndombe are approximates based on humanitarian maps.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 20-21 September. FARDC regained several territory from the Mai-Mai Yakutumba along the border between Maniema and South-Kivu over two days of fighting. On the first day, fighting in Tubangoyi (Sud-Kivu) left fatalities on both sides. The next day, clashes were reported in Kabeya (Maniema), Mai Ndombe (Sud-Kivu) and Kilembwe (Sud-Kivu). Coordinates of Tubangoyi and Mai Ndombe are approximates based on humanitarian maps.

Coordinates of Tubangoyi and Mai Ndombe are approximates based on humanitarian maps.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 21 September. Two alleged Mayi-Mayi were killed in an armed attack in the town of Butembo in North Kivu.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 20-21 September. FARDC regained several territory from the Mai-Mai Yakutumba along the border between Maniema and South-Kivu over two days of fighting. On the first day, fighting in Tubangoyi (Sud-Kivu) left fatalities on both sides. The next day, clashes were reported in Kabeya (Maniema), Mai Ndombe (Sud-Kivu) and Kilembwe (Sud-Kivu). Coordinates of Tubangoyi and Mai Ndombe are approximates based on humanitarian maps.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 September. LUCHA activists marched in the cities of Beni and Kasindi in Beni territory to demand the holding of credible and peaceful elections in the DRC.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 September. LUCHA activists marched in the cities of Beni and Kasindi in Beni territory to demand the holding of credible and peaceful elections in the DRC.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua)
assoc_actor_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kifuafua) Ngendo Faction
notes: 20 September. The Mai-Mai Kifuafua Delphin Mbaenda attacked and chased after the Mai-Mai Kirikicho and Shalio at Busurungi village in Walikale territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 19 September. The commander of the Mayi-Mayi Yakutumba group, Dokis, was killed during heavy clashes with the military in Kipupu, South Kivu.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: CCAC: Civil Society Action Group
notes: 19 September. Five people were wounded, three seriously when police repressed a demonstration organised by the Civil Society Action Group (CCAC) in Kinshasa.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 18 September. Five unknown gunmen were killed in clashes with the FARDC in Jiro, a town 62 kilometers north of Bunia in the Walendu Tatsi Sector of Djugu Territory (approx. Coordinates used).

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 18 September. A person was killed during the attack on an FARDC position by alleged ADF rebels in Kokola, about 40km north of the city of Beni (North Kivu).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 17 September. Renewed clashes between the FARDC and Mayi-Mayi coalition groups in Kilembwe, in the territory of Fizi.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Kizamoto)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 17 September. The Raia Mutomboki Kizamoto coalition leader was shot dead in clashes with the FARDC  in the Bamuguba grouping in Shabunda territory (South Kivu).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 17 September.  Unidentified gunmen raided Rubaya village in Masisi territory. The attackers killed a policeman, a man and a woman. They also injured four people.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: Looting: 17 September. Two LRA combatants ambushed and looted two men 30km south of Bangadi.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 17 September. Two armed LRA combatants abducted a young girl 30 km south of Bangadi.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) Prison Guards
notes: 16 September. The Director of Rutshuru Prison and his wife were killed in their home by unidentified gunmen in Kiwanja City, about 70 km north of Goma.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 15 September. Eleven people, including one soldier, were killed in attacks on FARDC naval forces' positions in Muvaramu, Songamoya and Tara in Djugu territory (Ituri) between 15-16 September. 11 fatalities spread across the three locations. Approx. Coordinates used for all locations at around 80km north of Bunia along the Lake Albert.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 15 September. Approx. Coordinates used for all locations at around 80km north of Bunia along the Lake Albert.

actor1: Tshiyoyo Militia
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 15 September. At least 10 people were seriously injured in a clash between security forces and alleged Tshiyoyo militiamen in Tshipidinga locality, in the vicinity of Kananga airport.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
notes: 15 September. The FARDC went to support the Burundian army at Gatumba border post during a RED TABARA attack. During the attackers' retreat, they killed three FARDC soldiers and two children on Congolese soil in the rural commune of Uvira.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 12 September. A police officer was killed Wednesday (September 12th) in Maboya in Beni territory in an attack attributed to the Mai-Mai.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: 12 September. DR Congo's navy on Wednesday accused Ugandan troops of killing four Congolese fishermen after their bodies surfaced on Lake Edward.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 12 September. An alleged FRPI militiamen shot and killed a student in the village called "Supreme", located 93 kilometers south of Bunia in the Walendu Bindi chiefdom in Irumu territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Movement of forces: 10 September. The Armed Forces of the DRC deployed a unit in Butale. The deployment is due to a recent visit of an area chief

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 09 September. A person was killed in a suspected ADF attack FARDC positions in two neighbourhoods (Ngadi and Nzuma) in Beni.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 09 September. A person was killed in a suspected ADF attack FARDC positions in two neighbourhoods (Ngadi and Nzuma) in Beni.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 09 September. Police shoot and member of the National Intelligence Agency in Bendera during an altercation.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 09 September. Republican Guard soldier was arrested for shooting a civilian at the public port of Goma (North Kivu). The victim was shot and wounded as he opened the door from his home to answer the call of soldiers. Motives unknown.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
assoc_actor_2: Government of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 09 September. Two agents of the Congolese Institute for the Conservation of Nature were seriously injured during an ambush held on their convoy by suspected LRA rebels in Banda, an area in Dikuma.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 September. Twenty people were seriously injured, shops and houses looted and many other material damage reported during the skirmishes in the evening at Balese neighbourhood in Mangobo commune in Kisangani. The unrest stemmed from a dispute between the Kata motorcycle youth association of the Matete district and the Bourgeois youth association of the Balese district.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Binakwa)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On or before 07 September. The Raia Mutomboki Kokodikoko shot and killed a policeman in Bulumbu village in Bamuguba Sud grouping, east Shabunda (coordinate approx. based on source map). The policeman killed was the commander of the Kigulube police station.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 05 September. Clashes between the FARDC and Nyatura fighters left at least two civilians killed and five seriously injured in the town of Rugari, Rutshutru territory, North Kivu. Among the wounded, there are two soldiers.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 September. At least 23 peaceful protesters were injured, six of them severely, while another 89 were arrested in the capital Kinshasa, and in Goma, Lubumbashi, Bukavu, Mbandaka, Mbuji-Mayi and Tshikapa as police violently dispersed peaceful protests on the use of electronic voting machines in the upcoming elections slated for 23 December. Among the arrested were seven LUCHA activists, they were released the following day.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 03 September. Fifteen activists from the Citizen's Struggle for Change movement (LUCHA) were wounded and admitted to the hospital as police dispersed a march initiated by the movement in Goma. During the demonstration, three local journalists were assaulted by the police.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 03 September. The ADF attacked a FARDC position in Ngadi, about 12 km from the centre of Beni city near the Rwenzori forest but they were repelled. Loyalist forces repelled them after violent clashes. Civil society claims that several assets of the population were looted by the alleged ADF during this attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On or before 03 September. The FARDC attacked unidentified gunmen who wanted to occupy the Luziba mine site in Lumbishi village in Kalehe territory.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: MLC: Movement for the Liberation of Congo
assoc_actor_2: FCC: Common Front for Congo
notes: 01 September. Militants of the Mouvement de liberation du Congo and those of the Common Front for Congo (FCC) threw stones at each other and clashed as they gathered to greet their respective delegations at the Gemena airport (South Ubangi). The MLC militants began throwing stones at the FCC ones after learning that their delegation would not land in Gemena.

actor1: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On or before 01 September. The FDLR-FOCA and Nyatura FDP coalition counter-attacked an FARDC position in Machazo village in Rutshuru territory. This attack resulted in one FARDC soldier killed and another wounded.

actor1: ADF-NALU: Allied Democratic Forces-National Army for the Liberation of Uganda
notes: 31 August. Five people were killed by suspected ADF rebels in Kakuka at the border with Ituri.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 31 August. 18 people kidnapped as LRA attacked Sili village in Ango territory (Bas-Uele).

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
notes: 29 August. The vice president of the youth of the locality of Mera in the territory of Walikale (North Kivu) was murdered by alleged Mai-Mai fighters of the NDC-Renovated Mwissa Shirirayi, aka Guidon in Kibua.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 27 August - on or about. Elements of the NDC / Renove tried to enter the agglomeration of Kasugho in the south of Lubero territory (North Kivu) but were repulsed by the army. At least 4 of their elements were killed and another captured.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 27 August. The militiamen of the Nduma defence of Congo (NDC / Renove) movement attacked the Mai-Mai Mazembe in the Pitakongo village in the south of Lubero territory (North Kivu). NDC won after a 2h battle. Some dead and wounded reported. The village had been under Mazembe control for the last three years. Unknown casualties coded as 5.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 27 August. 21 people kidnapped as LRA attacked Sili village in Ango territory (Bas-Uele).

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 26 August. LRA elements killed two policemen in the town of Banda in Bas-Uele before taking 30 people hostage. Coded as two separate events.

actor1: LRA: Lords Resistance Army
notes: 26 August. LRA elements killed two policemen in the town of Banda in Bas-Uele before taking 30 people hostage. Coded as two separate events.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On August 25, members of the Unified Lumumbist Party (PALU) demonstrated in Gungu city, capital of Kwilu territory, against the inadmissibility of the candidacies of Antoine Gizenga and Adolphe Muzito in upcoming elections in that territory.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 25 August. Five people were wounded after supporters of the Unified Lumumbist Party (PALU) who had come down to ransack their party headquarters in Gungu clashed with the police in Gungu. This followed the invalidation of Antoine Gizenga's and Muzito's files in the next presidential election.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On or before 21 August. The police tortured a man arrested for kidnapping in the rural commune of Kasindi. The victim died of his injuries in jail.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On or before 24 August. The ADF raided Mukoko village in Beni territory. Alerted by the population, the FARDC, supported by MONUSCO contingents, attacked and chased the attackers from the village.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Hapa na pale)
assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
notes: On August 19, four employees of the Red Cross have been kidnapped by a group of Hapa Na Pale Mayi Mayi militants in Tanganyika province. The incident occurred in Mponda Luganza, within Kongolo territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On or before 17 August. An FARDC soldier shot two civilians in Kasoko village in Rutshuru territory. The incident took place at a roadblocks set up by the FARDC where they taxed passersby. One fatality, one injury.

actor1: Military Forces of Angola (1975-)
notes: On August 15, Angolan military were accused of kidnapping more than 50 DRC civilians in Veve village, Kakongo sector, Lukula territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On August 13, the FARDC launched two simultaneous military operations against the NDC / Renovated Guidon in Kaheri and Kasuo in Lubero territory (North Kivu). One soldier died in the attack and 4 militiamen. The two villages have been occupied by the militants for over a year. The militants were forced to retreat to Kasuo following the FARDC operation.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On August 11, six civilians were killed and dozens of cattle looted by alleged ADF in the city of MayiMoya, Beni territory of North Kivu.

actor1: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
notes: On August 11, the FNL-Nzabampema ambushed a mini bus near Kawizi village, Uvira territory, leaving two people killed, five injured and robbing money and property.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On August 10, men carrying crude weapons attacked a police station in Manguredjipa village, Lubero territory. A policeman was injured in the attack.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On August 9, armed men attacked the villages of Kalengera and Kishadu in Nyangezi group in the Wulungu area (South Kivu). One person killed, one injured and a girl raped. Fatality coded in one event.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On August 9, armed men attacked the villages of Kalengera and Kishadu in Nyangezi group in the Wulungu area (South Kivu). One person killed, one injured and a girl raped. Fatality coded in one event.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (International)
notes: On August 9, FDLR-RUD militants attacked a vehicle from the Norwegian NGO NRC near Ngwenda village, Rutshuru territory. The attackers abducted six of the Ngo workers and released them on the same day.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
notes: On August 9, two fishermen on their way to fishing were kidnapped by the Mai-Mai Charles, near Magiso village, Rutshuru territory.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On August 8, the Mai-Mai Charles have reoccupied the bays of Tchanika and Ndwali (near Rwindi), on the southwest coast of Lake Edward, in the Virunga National Park to the boundaries with the territory of Rutshuru. This followed the departure of FARDC soldiers from their positions in the area held since August.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On August 8, two people (a woman and a soldier) were killed in an attack by alleged ADF in Kasinga, North Kivu. The ADF came from the forest of Mayangose.

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
notes: On August 8, at least 12 civilians were killed in Kiniana, Kalungu locality, close to Kitchanga, North Kivu, during clashes between the NDC / Renove de Guidon militias and the Nyatura. According to the local police, who delivers the information, some victims have already been buried.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On August 8, FARDC soldiers were able to capture four armed men and two armed women attempting to rob a gold trading post in Kalingi village, Mwenga territory. The FARDC also recovered two AK47 weapons and a grenade.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On August 7, police fired teargas at stone-throwing supporters of opposition leader Felix Tshisekedi in Kinshasa as he drove to the electoral commission to file his candidacy for president.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) Virunga National Park
assoc_actor_2: Farmers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On August 7, some Virunga park rangers and FARDC people burned homes and food crops in farmers' fields during a peasant eviction operation in Sekwekwe village, Rutshuru territory. They also looted sacks of maize.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
assoc_actor_2: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
notes: On August 6, supporters of opponent Moise Katumbi and women organisations protested in Lubumbashi to demand his return to the DRC. Police fired live bullets at the protesters and arrested some, some of whom were quickly released. A young boy died of his injuries while others were hospitalised.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
notes: On August 6, Mai-Mai Mazembe fighters shot and injured a young man in Bukomerwa village, Lubero territory. The 30-year-old man died two days later.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On August 6, unidentified gunmen ambushed a FARDC team that was looking for a missing man in a field in Sulungwe village, Beni territory. A man died during this ambush.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On August 2, the Armed Forces of the DRC recovered the rear base of the Mai-Mai / Charles de Tchanika, south of Lake Edward, in Rutshuru territory.

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
notes: On August 2, a NDC Guidon militant shot and killed a man in Mpombi village, Rutshuru territory.
